sub_title: PhD candidate at Wageningen University and Research
summary: I am partisan of research-action towards rural populations exposed to natural hazards. I am driven by the motivation to study about and for vulnerable populations and connecting natural and social sciences.

education.field_of_study: Rural Engineering major Hydraulics and Rural Development

projects.title: Digital soil mapping of Plancoët Commune (Brittany, France)
projects.description:
Our study aimed to represent on maps the different soils of Plancoët commune and their characteristics. 
Soil samplings and surveys for chemical laboratory analysis have been conducted to describe the physical and chemical characteristics of the soils. Electrical conduction analysis have been carried out with an EM38 conductivity meter. By using an Ordinary Kriging method, we were able to interpolate the soil resistivity, delineate texture, stoniness, the bedrock and its depth.

contributors.headline: PhD candidate at Wageningen University and Research

projects.title: Floodplain mapping by the Vilaine River in Guipry Commune
projects.description: This project in fluvial hydraulics aimed to simulate the water line of the Vilaine River during floods using  Mike 11, Mike 21 and ArcGIS softwares.

contributors.headline: PhD candidate at Wageningen University and Research

projects.title: Identifying the areas where the natural heritage of Brocéliande's clump is the most vulnerable.
projects.description:
This study aimed to represent the preservation of the natural heritage through GIS. 
We focused on two degradation issues of this heritage : soil erosion and fires hazards. Thus, we have chosen to establish two maps describing the vulnerability to soil erosion and fire outbreak in the studied area. A similar method has been used to establish both maps : identification of the risk factor, establishment of a decision tree and layout of the final maps.

contributors.headline: PhD candidate at Wageningen University and Research

projects.title: QR Code Project : What are the prospects for the use of new information and communication technologies to popularize the practices and outcomes of the agro-environmental research ?
projects.description:
This project is a request from the scientific community to address the problem of the limited shared scientific data in a geographical area rich in information and involving a large public (students, researchers and farmers). 
Thus, we chose to take the example of the "Brittany Area Workshop" (led by a wide inter-organisms and inter-disciplinary network) to demonstrate the usefulness of the installation of QR Code. According to the different data available in soil sciences, hydrology and ecology, we prepared an educational exercise for the 1st year in Master students. This exercise includes several questions requiring for their resolution information hosted on a computer platform accessible from QR codes placed on different sectors of the area. These QR codes can be "flashed", from smartphones and tablets provided for the occasion, and refer to a platform where the necessary data are hosted. 
Due to these particular media, the format of the information had to be simple. To do this, we used the R Shiny package to be able to create interactive applications on the Internet and real-time updated data. The hosting on a linked web page allows, among others, a first protection concerning the access of these data by setting up, for example, a user name and password for their display.

authors.headline: PhD candidate at Wageningen University and Research

profile_positions.description:
Through this PhD, it is sought to develop and test indicators depicting the extent that the water uses in Northeastern Brazil are contributing to socioeconomic and environmental drought impacts. Such local and contextualized indicators aim to link water accounting data to tangible decision-making for water and drought managers.
This PhD is conducted within the “3ddd project: Diagnosing drought for dealing with drought in 3D: Toolbox for increasing drought preparedness of actors in water and climate governance, starting from north-eastern Brazil”.
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate

profile_positions.title: Project Employee

profile_positions.description:
Animation of a collective of farmers, researchers and policymakers on the issue of the valorisation of research findings, in the field of water and soil conservation.
Support to the development and implementation of a methodological approach to get those different stakeholders involved to develop, in a concerted way, operational tools based on a range of topics important to Tunisian policymakers and responding to the field challenges.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
This internship has been carried out in partnership with "Lisode", a firm of consultants specialized in the research and engineering in participatory approaches. It aimed to analyze the technical and regulatory relevance of the deployment of constructed wetlands in order to improve the water quality of the Champigny aquifer.
Constructed Wetlands (CW) are designed to collect agricultural drainage waters loaded with pesticides and nutrients.They aim to mitigate the polluting flows before their discharge into the natural environment.
This study has been divided into two parts.

Technical part
•	Analysis of the pesticides' degradation capacity of a CW
•	Hydrological diagnostic in order to extrapolate a first pilot site to a larger scale. 
•	Determination of potential locations in a watershed for the establishment of CW

Socio-institutional part

•	Field surveys conducted with stakeholders on various levels of the agro-environmental sphere
•	Setting of the territory main issues and analysis of the different local and national policies related to an intervention on the issue of non-point source agricultural pollution
•	Initiation in the construction of a tool, in the form of a dialogue support, aiming to address the matter of non-point source agricultural pollution and the settlement of CW with potentially concerned stakeholders (multi stakeholders process)
profile_positions.title: Environmental Engineering Intern

profile_positions.description:
This internship has been realized as part of a graduation project.
The research theme focuses on the "analysis of the functioning and the hydro-agronomic evolution of the lowlands area in Kairouan's plain" and has been lead in collaboration with the Agronomic National Institute of Tunisia and the CIRAD within the framework of the ARENA project.

The theme of this internship is first, to understand the dynamics of these areas and to analyze their impact on the socio-agro-environmental system including them.
The first step has thus been a diachronic reconstitution and analysis. 
This historical reconstitution has been done on maps and through the bibliography and allowed us to free up the major and key events. It highlights :
- The waters various uses (surface water and groundwater resources)
- Types of soils and land use planning practices
- Landscaping and exploitation of different natural resources

The historical reconstitution and the perception in terms of vulnerability of the system has been questioned through surveys conducted with local stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Intern in Rural Engineering (Hydraulics and Rural Development)

company.name: Bureau Technique pour le Développement - BTD

profile_positions.company: Bureau Technique pour le Développement - BTD
profile_positions.description:
- Field work :
Flow measurements using a current meter for El Berdaouni springs inside the underground catchments structures
Supervision of the drilling operations of public wells :
- Field observations
- Training and familiarization with the drilling techniques, machines and associated equipments (such as drilling bits, drilling collars, drilling pipes, injection head, stabilizers, etc...)
- Supervision of the casings and screens installation (checking the appropriate diameters, thickness, length and material)
Pumping tests for private and public wells

-Office work :
Design of the drilling, casings and screenings of a deep water well (1200 m) under the following conditions :
    The well is empty ; sea water intrusions occur from -20 m to -1200 m depths ; the well is full of fresh water and ready to be exploited taking into account the safety factors
Interpretation of the pumping tests for private and public wells
Calculation of the flow measurements' data using BIBER software
profile_positions.title: Internship in Hydraulic Engineering

profile_positions.description:
“Study case and Sizing of the Casings for a Petroleum Well Y1 located in the Center of Tunisia”
- Wells’ architecture and drilling procedure
- Casings’ aims and procedure of setting up
- Method of choice of the casings: Choice of the casing connection type and of the steel grade for the intermediate and production casings by calculating the stresses strain (e.g. collapse, burst, traction) and for many plausible scenarios.
profile_positions.title: Drilling Engineering Intern
